name: gypsum quarry operation | anhydrite rock | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19699/documentation

The multi-output-process 'mining, gypsum' delivers the co-products 'gypsum, mineral, at mine' and 'anhydrite rock, at mine'. Allocation is done by weight. In some mines anhydrite is not exploited but left in the mine. Since the electricity consumption has a relevant share on the total energy consumption, the choice of the energy mix is important. For gypsum mined in countries with high fossil share in the electricity mix this module has to be adopted accordingly.5.57E+08 kg is the yearly average  amount of gypsum produced in South Africa between 2007 - 2012 (Sources:www.dmr.gov.za  (PUBLICATIONS/MINERAL ECONOMICS). ;;Major markets for natural gypsum in South Africa are plasterboards (calcined gypsum) and cement manufacture (uncalcined gypsum), followed by the agricultural sector where it is used for soil treatment (Source: Department of Mineral Resources SA (2009), Gypsum in South Africa, Report R82/2009;). ;

quarrying of the gypsum 

mining and crushing of gypsum and anhydrite
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data has been extrapolated from "gypsum quarry operations, GLO" dataset. Accessed 20171128.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: open-cast mining; composition of products: South Africa's gypsum deposits consist of several ‘types’ of gypsum, from high-grade powdery gypsum which contains about 90% pure gypsum, to gypsum mixed with clay containing around 65% to 85% gypsum (Source: Oosterhuis, W.R., 1998, Gypsum, In: Wilson, M.G.C. and Anhaeusser, C.R. (Eds.), The Mineral Resources of South Africa: Handbook, Silverton: Council for Geoscience, pp. 394-399). For calulation purposes it is assumed that gypsum content is 65% (lowest content locally) and anhydrite content is 34%, and 1 % is other elements.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated values: “gypsum quarry operation, GLO 2003” dataset accessed 2017/11/13.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Secondary data from the "Department of Mineral Resources SA (2009), Gypsum in South Africa, Report R82/2009". Extrapolated values: “gypsum quarry operation, GLO 2003” dataset accessed 2017/11/13.

exchanges.description:
The amount was calculated relative to the production volumes.
